history.content:
As much as I want the class to be expanded (I'm a fellow senior undergrad), please understand that resources (GSIs) are limited. The undergrad GSIs for this class in the past have mostly graduated by now, and finding grad students to teach an upper division class has always been challenging (plus Joe just came back from a sabbatical, I don't know if he advised any grad students during this whole time).

I was screwed before in 170 Spring 13 and 189 Spring 14 for somewhat similar reasons. It's part of the Berkeley experience, especially when demand is much higher than supply at this time. Don't put a lot of high expectation into having the class expanded, and find a backup instead.

The waitlist has been significantly expanded.  We apologize for that bottleneck. 

It's too early to be clear about whether there will be capacity to significantly expand CS186 enrollment limit beyond the current 229 or the projected 327 final enrollment limit.  That won't be likely be clear until at least the beginning of January.  The first step to clarity will require Prof Hellerstein to stop by and talk to Michael-David in 379 Soda.
I'll pass this information along. I can't promise what the outcome will be, but I appreciate the feedback.

children.subject: I recommend the department to reserve certain amount of seats for juniors this time. Thinking in a long run, who can help if there is still high demand next spring? Only curreny junior who will become senior next year can become UGSIs in order to make the class bigger.

This was predicted by so many students last semester. We even signed  a petition to ensure this would not happen. 
http://www.change.org/p/david-culler-petition-for-the-offering-of-cs-186-in-fall-2014

This is going to just get worse over the semesters if the CS staff does not intervene.

According to Berkeleytime, IB 140 is only offered in the spring as well. Last year, about 400 students were in the course, so in order for that to be a possibility, the current room CS186 has (Li Kai Shing) would need 400 spaces. Currently EE20 has about 300 people attending in Li Kai Shing, so cramming 400 people into a 300 person room would be rough for the IB 140 students. As for other rooms, Chem 3A has ~900 students across 2 sections (8 am and 2 pm, guess which will be more popular) in Pimentel, a crucial building for displaying Chem demos. Econ 100B has consistently had 400 students in past semesters. Math 1A actually looks like the most reasonable room switch at the moment. They have a 400 person room, but ~330 people enrolled at the end of tele bears according to last year. Just giving some info, it's really up to staff as far as room switches go.

It's not entirely up to CS staff either, since there's overall a lot of campus restrictions in getting large rooms. 

Of course, the more practical limit is GSIs and sections, which I don't know how those numbers look. 

It could be possible to do a simulcast of 186 from 245 LKS to some other lecture hall, since 245 is more than capable of video recording and streaming.

You do realize that CS186 is limited by the number of GSIs to handle discussions and not by the lecture hall, right? IB140 was assigned there for a reason; just because you want an expansion of CS186 doesn't mean that we can just switch it with IB140.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/berkeleycs/permalink/748781745216701/ "Ronald Kwan larger rooms at the same time... 2050 VLSB - Math 1A 155 Dwinelle - Econ 100B 1 Pimentel - Chem 3A Wheeler Aud - IB 140 20 hrs · Like · 1" "Victoria Lo ^ I feel like IB 140 can be moved.... I haven't heard much about that class at all in terms of popularity and I'm also an IB major... Only 35 enrolled right now according to ninjacourses (too lazy to look up on schedule.berkeley.edu) 13 hrs · Edited · Like" IB 140 is in Wheeler Auditorium, which would give 186 a lot of space. Can we switch with IB 140?

+1

I am transfer student and current senior with 112 units, and i tried to enroll cs186 yesterday,

http://osoc.berkeley.edu/OSOC/osoc?p_term=SP&x=21&p_classif=--+Choose+a+Course+Classification+--&p_deptname=--+Choose+a+Department+Name+--&p_presuf=--+Choose+a+Course+Prefix%2fSuffix+--&y=1&p_course=186&p_dept=cs

Show 108 on waitlist, but i am waitlist in position 178. i am wondering how waitlist works. 

Also, i will graduate on FALL 2015, it is last chance for me to take this class. So please do extend.
If he's teaching 286B this semester, then how could he NOT be back from sabbatical?
Anon who posted the student answer: Joe came back from Sabbatical? I know he's teaching 286 now, but his homepage still shows that he's on leave.
anyone volunteer to start a Google Doc with names of all students that want and cant get into 186? maybe a petition calling to expand the course...

It is very unlikely that MDS will see this. You should either post a new question or email him directly.

(preferably post a new question so the rest of us can see the answer!!)
Michael-David, has Professor Hellerstein stopped by your office to talk about 186 yet?

history.content:
The schedule.berkeley.edu page for CS186 and the the ScheduleBuilder page for CS186 say:
Enrollment on 10/22/14: Limit:327 Enrolled:229 Waitlist:108 Avail Seats:98 229 student(s) are enrolled, with a limit of 327 and 108 student(s) are on the waiting list, with a limit of 108.
There are a lot of threads on Facebook about students not getting into CS186: 1. https://www.facebook.com/groups/berkeleycs/permalink/748781745216701/ 2. https://www.facebook.com/groups/berkeleycs/permalink/749321641829378/ 3. https://www.facebook.com/groups/berkeleycs/permalink/749328935161982/ 4. https://www.facebook.com/groups/berkeleycs/permalink/749284358499773/ 5. https://www.facebook.com/groups/631097886985088/permalink/749253565169519/ 6. https://www.facebook.com/groups/631097886985088/permalink/749297491831793/ Will CS186 get expanded? Please move 186 to a bigger room to let more people in. It wasn't taught this semester, so there is a HUGE increase in people taking the class. A lot of graduating seniors will be shut out from the class if it's not expanded. Screenshots below to show the significant level of community support for expanding CS186:
history.subject: Please Expand CS186
